methods.Synopsis: Create a reseller customer

parameters.Name: username
parameters.Description: The new username for the customer you are creating. No more than 64 characters.

parameters.Name: password
parameters.Description: The password for the new customer being created. Must be at least 6 characters.

parameters.Name: confirm_password
parameters.Description: Must match password and must be at least 6 characters.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: Must be a valid email string. No more than 64 characters.

parameters.Name: first_name
parameters.Description: First name of the customer being created. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: last_name
parameters.Description: Last name of the customer being created. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: address
parameters.Description: New customer's address. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: city
parameters.Description: New customer's city. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: state
parameters.Description: New customer's state. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: zip
parameters.Description:
New customer's postal code. This field is not
validated. Please validate postal code after client input.

parameters.Name: country
parameters.Description: New customer's country. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: The new customer phone number. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: website
parameters.Description: The new customer website. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: company
parameters.Description: The new customer company name. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: package
parameters.Description: The name of the service package that will be assigned to the new customer. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: whitelabel
parameters.Description: The domain name that will be used for The new customer whitelabeling. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description: Optional array of ip_group names to which the new customer will be assigned. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: ip[]
parameters.Description: Optional array of IP addresses to which the new customer will be assigned, the package allows it. No more than 255 characters. IP addresses must belong to you.

parameters.Name: free_user
parameters.Description: If true, the new customer will be a free customer.

parameters.Name: billing_date
parameters.Description: Optionally specify the new customerâ€™s billing date. If unspecified, the creation date will be used. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format. This date must be within one month from the time of creation, e.g. if the customer is created on 2011-02-28, then the latest date you can use is 2011-03-28.

methods.Synopsis:
Remove a customer from your account. This is not the same as disabling a customer on our system. However, the removed user will still be stored within the system so that you cannot re-register a new user with this new username.

This is the same thing as closing out a customer's account at the end of their billing cycle.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The username of the customer you wish to delete.

methods.Synopsis: Obtain a list of all customers, optionally filtered by properties.

parameters.Name: task
parameters.Description:
Must be set to get in order
to retrieve user information

parameters.Name: active
parameters.Description: Search filter for whether or not the customer is currently active.

parameters.Name: first_name
parameters.Description: Search filter for customer's first name.

parameters.Name: last_name
parameters.Description: Search filter for customer's last name.

parameters.Name: zip
parameters.Description: Search filter for customer's postal code.

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: Search filter for customer's phone number.

methods.Synopsis: Enable a customer so they may start sending out emails again. This call will not enable website access.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The user account to enable. Must be in email format.

methods.Synopsis: Prevent an account from sending emails with SendGrid.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The user account to enable. Must be in email format.

methods.Synopsis: Grant user access to login to SendGrid.com

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The user account to enable. Must be in email format.

methods.Synopsis: Revoke user access to login to SendGrid.com

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The user account to disable. Must be in email format.

methods.Synopsis: Update a reseller customer

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The username of the customer to update.

parameters.Name: first_name
parameters.Description: The updated customer first name. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: last_name
parameters.Description: The updated customer last name. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: address
parameters.Description: The updated customer address. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: city
parameters.Description: The updated customer city. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: state
parameters.Description: The updated customer state. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: zip
parameters.Description:
The updated customer postal code. This field is not
validated. Please validate postal code after client input.

parameters.Name: country
parameters.Description: The updated customer country. No more than 100 characters.

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: The updated customer phone number. No more than 50 characters.

parameters.Name: website
parameters.Description: The updated customer website. No more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: company
parameters.Description: The updated customer company name. No more than 255 characters.

methods.Synopsis: Reset a customer's password. Passwords are encrypted and therefore cannot be retrieved.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The username of the customer whose password you want to update.

parameters.Name: password
parameters.Description: New customer password. Must be at least 6 characters.

parameters.Name: confirm_password
parameters.Description: Must match password parameter and be at least 6 characters.

methods.Synopsis: Change customer's username. The account username is used to login to our SMTP server and the website, and changes take effect immediately.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The username of the account for which to update the username.

parameters.Name: username
parameters.Description: The new username. Must be in email format, not more than 100 characters, cannot be already taken and cannot contain SendGrid.com in the domain name.

methods.Synopsis: Change customer's username. The account username is used to login to our SMTP server and the website, and changes take effect immediately.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The username of the account for which to update the email address.

parameters.Name: username
parameters.Description: The new username. Must be in email format, not more than 100 characters, cannot be already taken and cannot contain SendGrid.com in the domain name.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve statistics for a specified customer. Note that you can use either the days parameter or the start_date and end_date parameter.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve statistics.

parameters.Name: days
parameters.Description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve statistics (includes today).

parameters.Name: start_date
parameters.Description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve statistics. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be earlier than the end_date parameter

parameters.Name: end_date
parameters.Description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve statistics. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be later than the start_date parameter

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve all-time statistics for a customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve statistics.

parameters.Name: aggregate
parameters.Description: Must be set to 1 to retrieve aggregate statistics.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve a list of customer's categories.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve statistics.

methods.Synopsis:
Retrieve a customer's statistics broken down by category. If the category does not exist, there will be an empty result set.

Note that you can use either the days parameter or the start_date and end_date parameter.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The user for which to retrieve category statistics.

parameters.Name: category
parameters.Description: The category for which to retrieve statistics. Can also be an array containing multiple categories.

parameters.Name: days
parameters.Description: The number of days in the past for which to retrieve category statistics, including today.

parameters.Name: start_date
parameters.Description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve category statistics. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be earlier than the end_date parameter

parameters.Name: end_date
parameters.Description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve category statistics. Date must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be later than the start_date parameter.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve a customer's list of bounced email addresses.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve bounces.

parameters.Name: date
parameters.Description: If set to 1, bounce timestamps will be returned in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

methods.Synopsis: Since SendGrid does not re-deliver to bounced addresses, users can remove bounces from their list if redelivery to a bounced address is desired.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to remove bounces.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address to remove from the bounce list.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve a customer's list of invalid email addresses.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve invalid emails.

parameters.Name: date
parameters.Description: If set to 1, invalid email timestamps will be returned in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

methods.Synopsis: Since SendGrid does not re-deliver to invalid email addresses, users can remove them from their list if redelivery to an invalid address is desired.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to remove bounces.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address to remove from the invalid email list.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve a customer's list of spam reports.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve spam reports.

parameters.Name: date
parameters.Description: If set to 1, spam report timestamps will be returned in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

methods.Synopsis: Since SendGrid does not re-deliver to addresses reporting spam, users can remove them from their list if redelivery is desired.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to remove spam reports.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address to remove from the spam report list.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve a customer's list of spam reports.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve unsubscribes.

parameters.Name: date
parameters.Description: If set to 1, unsubscribe timestamps will be returned in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

methods.Synopsis: Since SendGrid does not deliver to unsubscribed addresses, users can remove them from their list if redelivery is desired.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to remove unsubscribes.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address to remove from the unsubscribe list.

methods.Synopsis: Add unsubscribe records to a user account. Email will not be sent to unsubscribed email addresses.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to add unsubscribes.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address to add to the unsubscribe list.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve account limits for a specific customer. If the API call response is empty, no limits are currently applied.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve limits.

methods.Synopsis: Remove all limits for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to remove limits.

methods.Synopsis: A recurring reset will allow you to periodically reset a customer's credits to a number you specify. This can be daily, weekly or monthly.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to apply a recurring reset.

parameters.Name: credits
parameters.Description: The number of credits that the customer will have after each recurring reset. Must be greater than 0.

parameters.Name: period
parameters.Description: How often the customer's credits will be reset.

parameters.Name: startdate
parameters.Description: The start date for the recurring reset.

parameters.Name: enddate
parameters.Description: The end date for the recurring reset.

parameters.Name: initial_credits
parameters.Description: The number of credits to initially grant the customer. If this is not set, the credits will be reset using the credits parameter. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Set a customer's credits to the specified amount.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to set the number of credits.

parameters.Name: credits
parameters.Description: The number of credits to set for the customer. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Increment a customer's credits by a specified amount.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to increment credits.

parameters.Name: credits
parameters.Description: The number of credits to add to the customer's credit total. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Decrement a customer's credits by a specified amount.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to decrement credits.

parameters.Name: credits
parameters.Description: The number of credits to subtract from the customer's credit total. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Create a monitor record that allows you to inspect a sample of a customer's content.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name by which to identify the monitor record. Must be unique and fewer than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address where sampled content will be sent. Must be in email format.

parameters.Name: frequency
parameters.Description: How often sampled emails will be sent. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Make modifications to an existing monitor record.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the monitor record to edit.

parameters.Name: new_name
parameters.Description: The new name for the monitor. New name must be unique and canâ€™t be more than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: new_email
parameters.Description: The new email address where sampled content will be sent. Must be in email format.

parameters.Name: new_frequency
parameters.Description: How often sampled emails will be sent. Must be greater than 0.

methods.Synopsis: Remove a monitor from SendGridâ€™s system. Make sure no users are currently using the monitor record or removal will fail.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the monitor record to delete.

methods.Synopsis: List all existing monitor records.
Add a customer to a monitor record so their content will be sampled.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer to add to the monitor.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the monitor record to which the customer will be assigned.

methods.Synopsis: Remove the association between a monitor record and a customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer from which to remove the monitor.

methods.Synopsis: View all IPs for your account.

parameters.Name: ip
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP address by which to filter your results.

parameters.Name: system
parameters.Description: Include IPs assigned by SendGrid. If present, must be set to true.

methods.Synopsis: View all free IPs under your account. A free IP is any IP that is not in use by a customer and is not linked to an IP grouping.

parameters.Name: ip
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP address by which to filter your results.

methods.Synopsis: List all taken IPs under your account. A Taken IP is any IP that is in use by a customer or is linked to an IP grouping.

parameters.Name: ip
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP address by which to filter your results.

methods.Synopsis: List all available IPs under your account. An Available IP is any IP that is currently free, is assigned to an inactive user, or is not linked to an IP grouping.

parameters.Name: ip
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP address by which to filter your results.

methods.Synopsis: A list of customers using your IPs.

parameters.Name: ip
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP address by which to filter your results.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: A complete or partial username by which to filter your results.

parameters.Name: group
parameters.Description: A complete or partial IP group name by which to filter your results.

parameters.Name: system
parameters.Description: Include IPs assigned by SendGrid. If present, must be set to true.

methods.Synopsis: List all whitelabeled domains.
Assign a whitelabel record to a customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be assigned a whitelabel record.

parameters.Name: mail_domain
parameters.Description: The mail domain of the whitelabel record to which the customer be will assigned.

methods.Synopsis: Returns a unique URL that you can use to automatically login your customer.

parameters.Name: password
parameters.Description: The customer's password. Will authenticate immediately if provided.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be logging in.

methods.Synopsis: Get the event notification URL for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve the event notification URL.

methods.Synopsis: Set the event notification URL for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to set the event notification URL.

methods.Synopsis: Delete the event notification URL for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to delete the event notification URL.

methods.Synopsis: Authenticate a customer so that their account details can be displayed and managed independent of SendGrid.com.

parameters.Name: password
parameters.Description: The password submitted by the customer.

methods.Synopsis: Get parse settings for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve parse settings.

methods.Synopsis: Create an additional parse settings entry for the given customer.

parameters.Name: hostname
parameters.Description: The hostname for which to capture inbound email. Must be fewer than 255 characters.

parameters.Name: url
parameters.Description: The callback URL to which parse API POSTs will be sent.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to add the parse setting.

methods.Synopsis: Update an existing parse setting entry.

parameters.Name: hostname
parameters.Description: The hostname of the exist parse setting to be updated.

parameters.Name: url
parameters.Description: The updated callback URL to which parse API POSTs will be sent.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to edit the parse setting entry.

methods.Synopsis: List all of the available apps. Note: The name value in the result is used in all the other API calls to identify a app.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which available apps will be listed.

methods.Synopsis: Enable a specific app for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to activate the app.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the app to activate.

methods.Synopsis: Deactivate a specific app for a given customer.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to deactivate the app.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the app to be deactivated.

methods.Synopsis: Get a customer's settings for a specific app.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve app settings.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: The name of the app for which to retrieve settings.

methods.Synopsis: Return an array of invoice numbers.

parameters.Name: start_date
parameters.Description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve invoice numbers. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be earlier than the end_date.

parameters.Name: end_date
parameters.Description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve invoice numbers. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be later than the start date.

parameters.Name: status
parameters.Description: Filter by the status of the invoice.

methods.Synopsis: Get an array of invoices.

parameters.Name: start_date
parameters.Description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve invoices. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be earlier than the end date.

parameters.Name: end_date
parameters.Description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve invoices. Must be in YYYY-mm-dd format and be later than the start date.

parameters.Name: status
parameters.Description: Filter by the status of the invoice.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve invoices and usage by invoice number.
Retrieve current usage by invoice number.
Returns a list of all pending account changes for your customers.

parameters.Name: username
parameters.Description: A username by which to filter results.

parameters.Name: type
parameters.Description: The type of pending activity by which to filter the results.

methods.Synopsis: Cancel a pending account change.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to cancel the pending change.

methods.Synopsis: Immediately upgrade a customer. An invoice is generated for that user. If itâ€™s a free user to a paid account, the full price for that upgrade will be charged. If itâ€™s in between billing periods, a prorated discount will be applied to the invoice.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be upgraded.

parameters.Name: package
parameters.Description: The name of the package to which the user will be upgraded.

parameters.Name: ip[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are upgrading your user to
requires a whitelabel and/or an unique IP, you must assign a free IP to this user.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are upgrading your user to
does not require an IP or whitelabel, you must place them in an IP group.

methods.Synopsis: Immediately downgrade a customer. Once a downgrade happens, an invoice is generated for that customer. Free customers are not allowed to downgrade.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be downgraded.

parameters.Name: package
parameters.Description: The name of the package to which the customer will be downgraded.

parameters.Name: ip[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are downgrading your customer to
requires a whitelabel and/or an unique IP, you may assign a free IP to this customer using your assigned IPs from SendGrid.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are downgrading your customer
to does not require an IP or whitelabel, you may place them in an IP group.

methods.Synopsis: Close or revert an account to a free user immediately. An invoice is generated for that user with the new package price. If no overages are incurred, a invoice with zero amount due is generated.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer account to be closed.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description: The IP group the customer will be assigned to once the account is closed.

methods.Synopsis: Apply an upgrade at the end of the userâ€™s billing cycle. Once an upgrade happens, an invoice is generated for that user with the new package price. Prorated charges do not apply here.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be upgraded.

parameters.Name: package
parameters.Description: The name of the package to which the user will be upgraded.

parameters.Name: ip[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are upgrading your user to
requires a whitelabel and/or an unique IP, you must assign a free IP to this user.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are upgrading your user to
does not require an IP or whitelabel, you must place them in an IP group.

methods.Synopsis: Apply a downgrade at the end of the userâ€™s billing cycle. Once a downgrade happens, an invoice is generated for that user with the new package price. Prorated charges do not apply here.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer that will be downgraded.

parameters.Name: package
parameters.Description: The name of the package to which the customer will be downgraded.

parameters.Name: ip[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are downgrading your customer to
requires a whitelabel and/or an unique IP, you may assign a free IP to this customer using your assigned IPs from SendGrid.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description:
If the package you are downgrading your customer
to does not require an IP or whitelabel, you may place them in an IP group.

methods.Synopsis: Close or revert an account to a free user at the end of the userâ€™s billing cycle. Once a closure happens, an invoice is generated for that user with the new package price (if no overages are incurred, a invoice with zero amount due is generated.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer account to be closed.

parameters.Name: ip_group[]
parameters.Description: The IP group the customer will be assigned to once the account is closed.

methods.Synopsis: List all packages available to your account.
View general account information regarding a customer, including billing cycle, current billing cycle, credit usage, package, overage credits, etc.

parameters.Name: user
parameters.Description: The customer for which to retrieve account details.
